reviews.text: This temple is one of the famous temples of Himachal Pardesh. Here we can feel the real darshan of Jawala mata. As the weather can see the flamessage of fire without any fuel. Even if water. There we can feel the power of Mata. The market around the temple is also very good. There is also a temple called as tedda mandir which is at hight. It takes around 90 minutes to reach the tedda mandir as the way of this temple is very difficult. So every one can't go there. But some of the Pujaries are so good. While some of them are very nice. It's like to visit this temple again and again. JAI MATA DI!!!

The jwaladevi temple is dedicated to goddess jwala ji. This is an age old ashtagrih temple of jwala devi and one of the 51 shaktipeeth of india. The old temple is believed to be 1000 years old. The old temple was constructed by raja udit Narayan Singh of gaharwal village. The temple is located at the top of binog hills in the mussoorie at an altitude of 2104 metre. We know this temple was attacked and looted by mahmud of ghazni when he came after the turn of the millennium. The legend of the jwala ji temple relates to sati grand daughter of lord brahma and wife of lord shiva.

Awesome place , jai mata Di
Marvelous experience .
Heaven on Earth.
Best place to visit for people who are very religious. As it one of 51 shaktipith. Moreover market is very near.

Baniya Devi is an avatar of Godesses Durga. It is situtaied in somewhat hot region but area around temple is dense forest with 24hours running natural water and temperature is low compared to surrounding area. There are few shopes nearby. It have parking ground also connected to main road via pedestrian path. It's peaceful and refreshing.
I love this place for nature and peace
Jakholi  in Solan district is famous for  temple of goddess bhadrakali, ganpati,durga mata,mansa devi and lord Shiva.very nice place connected by road and having parking for vehicles.
